title: What movie got ruined for you before you got to see it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Atonement. Directed by Joe Wright soon after directing Pride and Prejudice, starring Keira Knightley and James McAvoy, i thought it was bound to please. Until I read the summary of the plot and understood what it was about. Not a story of true love overcoming adversity or even making a bit of headway until succumbing to greater forces. Won’t spoil it for anyone who still wants to see it, but it’s not about those things at all. But the book it’s based on, by Ian McEwan, is about as self-indulgent as a writer can get. 👎

The Exorist and the pea soup that Linda Blair was having to spew during her possession.I heard about it but didnt experience it for myself until my friends brother snuck us into the theatre at 12 years old. ( it was an R rating.)My friend and I traded books back and forth and we had read the book. It was scary. I was unervered because my mother thought we had seen a Disney film and then I had to cover that up when I was afraid to go to bed that night. No good deed goes unpunished.
